result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. Walber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jeremy M. Walber in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jeremy M. Walber in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF33 & 15CF136 (sentencing hearing), 15CF334 (plea hearing)
10:10 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

**Court proceeds on 15CF334 only at this time**
Atty Cousins indicates there is a plea agreement in the new file (15CF334).  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 15CF334 Count 1 - NO CONTEST 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF334 Counts 2 thru 8 are dismissed and read-in. 

**Court proceeds to sentencing on all three files at this time**
Court and both counsel have received a copy of the PSI.  There are no corrections or additions.  
Court and both counsel have received a copy of the PTSP report.  
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Cousins indicates the parties agree there are 16 days credit that can be applied to all counts. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF33 Count 2 - 
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.

15CF33 Count 3 -
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.

15CF33 Count 6 - 
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.

All of the above are concurrent with one another and concurrent with the other files as well. 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs after 12 months. 

15CF136 
4 years prison with 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision. 
Concurrent with all other charges.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs after 12 months. 

15CF334 Count 1 - 
4 years prison with 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision. 
Concurrent with all other charges. 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs after 12 months. 

Conditions of Extended Supervision as recommended in the PSI: 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Get all medications from 1 pharmacy.
Provide agent list of all medications prescribed. 
Sign all release of information forms so the agent can monitor his medication, pharmacies and treatment. 
Engage in any other assessment, treatment or counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, school fulltime or combination thereof.
Provide a DNA sample, if he hasn't done that before. 
Any contact with Angela Zavala must be approved by the DOC and his supervising agent. 
Pay costs on each count including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid at 25% of any new deposits in his prison account and balance due as a condition of Extended Supervision. 

16 days credit that shall be awarded on all cases and counts.
Sentencing hearing at 09-25-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Jeremy M. Walber in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-33, 15CF-213, 15CF-214 and 15CF-136.

9:56 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court. There is an agreement.
15CF-33 Defendant will plead to Count 2 and Count 3. Count 1, 4 and 5 dismissed and read in
15CF-136 Defendant will plead to Count 1.
State would argue sentencing.

15CF-213 and 15CF-214 will be dismissed and read in

Atty Drengler concurs.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court regarding paperwork of consolidating a Waupaca County Case. Atty Drengler requests a PSI be ordered.

15CF-213 and 15CF-214:
Preliminary Hearing is held at this time.
Court informs Defendant of right to preliminary hearing.
Defendant understands.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.
Court questions Defendant on wavier of preliminary hearing.
Court questions Atty Drengler regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds Defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waiving right of preliminary hearing.
Court believes a felonly has been committed and Defendant committed it.
State files information.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the information and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

State files all documents to the Court regarding consolidation and waiver.
Court has received and read the consolidation, 15CF-69, Waupaca County Court File.
Information, criminal complaint, Defendant's waiver of being tried in Waupaca County and consolidation are all filed with the Court.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 15CF-033 Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-033 Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Consolidated Charge from Waupaca County
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-136 Count 1


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-33: Count 1:Dismissed and Read In
15CF-33: Count 2: contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-33: Count 3: contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-33: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-33: Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
Waupaca County Case 15CF-69, being consolidated into 15CF-33: contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-136: Count 1: contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-213: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-214: Dismissed and Read In

Court questions Defendant. Defendant has been on probation in the past, which have been revoked.
State will likely recommend an imposed prison sentence.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
PSI is to be completed by September 18th, copies to be forwarded to counsel.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Drengler
Copy of email re: PTSP report
Status conference at 07-24-2015 09:00 am
The Pretrial Supervision Program is removed from both bond files 15CF33 and 15CF136.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  4

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Parties argued in re: bond changes.

3:41 p.m. Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
